meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Bobbie Harrison Jim Bell Joe Pipp Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #381.

td.p: Bobbie Harrison, a homemaker from Lake Bluff, Illinois
Jim Bell, a lawyer from Frankfort, Connecticut
Joe Pipp, an engineering graduate from Ann Arbor, Michigan (whose 2-day cash winnings total $17,500)

tr.td: RULERS
BOUNCE
THE HUMAN BODY
MUSICAL GEOGRAPHY
6-LETTER WORDS
MARXISMS

tr.td: Joe
Jim
Bobbie
AMERICAN HISTORY
AUTHORS

INSECTS
HODGEPODGE
(Alex: That last category, of course, means whatever we had left over from previous games.)

div.onmouseout:

"A horse is a horse, of course, of course,

Go right to the source and ask..."')

Actor who played main human role on TV show with this theme:
"A horse is a horse, of course, of course,
And no one can talk to a horse, of course,
That is, of course, unless the horse is the famous Mr. Ed.
Go right to the source and ask..."

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_DJ_6_3', 'clue_DJ_6_3_stuck', '(Jim: What is psychiatry?)
(Alex: Be more specific.)
(Jim: What is a psychiatrist?)
...
(Bobbie: What is psychology?)
(Alex: No...I\'ll ask you to be more specific.)
(Bobbie: What is psychotherapy?)
---
(Joe: [As the buzzer sounds.] What is psychoanalysis?)
(Alex: Be more specific.)
(Joe: What is Freudian psychoanalysis?)
---
(Alex: What we were going for, and it\'s the reason for the word "appropriately" in the clue is, What is [*]? That\'s how she made her name.)

child psychology

JoeJimBobbie
Triple Stumper
')
